intro: Ectasis penicilliflora, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus Ectasis. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its toxic sap, it is considered a potential weed in agricultural areas.
